column4: I just tried to enable the ATI driver on my thinkpad t43 and now can't get back to X.  I'm stuck in the terminal.
I followed the instructions on ubuntu.com -- tuxtheslacker: I'm hoping there is a way to finish the task, instead of reverting back...
the point would be to get back to X to find a solution.
I think I can go backwards from my commands.  I am trying to find them now.
to go backwards?
I'm just wondering if I just have to do one more thing and it will work... or do I have to go backwards 5 steps and then go foward those 5 steps again.
it's easier to just go to the xorg.conf
did you check to make sure your ATi card is supported to start with?
hmmm... no.  :S
I'd check that :-)
actually -- yes, before I bought the computer.  Ubuntu works fine on this model
yes, I'm asking about the proprietary driver...
of course *nix works fine, I'm asking about support for the proprietary.
the pages that I read about thinkpad t43 with this video card -- they were able to enable the driver.  I've followed their instructions with no luck.  This is the second time.
(the second time that I've tried)
oh okay.
then I'd go back, and redo those instructions....
I have my xorg.cong backed up, so I can just restore that then?
I'd revert first ,and then make sure it works :-)
you COULD in any other distro, I'm not 100% sure about ubuntu.
so go backwards on my 4 or 5 steps?
I'd get that double checked in here first.
